binary.name: rtmultiplex
binary.syntax: rtmultiplex [-vb] [-t timeout] [-L logname] [-T timename] [-pf portname] [-if pidname] [-lp lport] hostname rport

option.od: print the help message and exit.
print the RST version number and exit.
verbose. Log information to the console.
reset the connection if no packets are received in timeout seconds. By default, the timeout is 20 seconds.
attempt to restart the connection on failure after resetclk seconds. By default, the resetclk is 1 second.
log connections and information in the file logname. By default, connections are recorded in log.rt.
log the time that the last packet was received in the file timename. By default, the time is recorded in time.rt.
record the port number that the server is listening for connections on in the file portname. By default, the port is recorded in port.id.
record the process Identifier (PID) of the server in the file pidname. By default, the PID is recorded in pid.id.
force the server to listen on the local port number port. By default, the server requests a port number from the Operating System.
hostname or IP number of the system to connect to.
port numbers to connect to on the server.

description.p: The task acts as both server and client attaching to a remote host and relaying the data stream to the client tasks.

example.description: Connects to the remote host peanut.jhuapl.edu at port 1024. Relay data from a port allocated by the operating system. The port number is recorded in the file "port.id" and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.rt".

Connects to the remote host peanut.jhuapl.edu at port 1200. Relay data from the port 5000. The port number is recorded in the file "port.id" and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.rt".
